/etc/init.d and /etc/rc2.d
yes, well, so maybe I could modify the /etc/init.d/mpd and /etc/init.d/icecast2 to start later or in different order. Is there a gui for this?

to explain. /etc/init.d contains scripts to be executed at boot. /etc/rc2.d contain symlinks to the programs in /etc/init.d. each symlink has got a letter S or K (Start or Kill), a number 0-99 (priority) and the name of the script. creating a symlink to mpd with the name S99mpd would Start mpd last (0 is first, 99 is last)
no gui as far as I know but the principle is simple.

if you already have a symlink for mpd and icecast in /etc/rc2.d you can simply rename them to change the start order :)
